MainClaim.text: "The American Enlightenment was a distinct intellectual movement that shared many ideas with the European Enlightenment

AmericanEnlightenment.text: "The American Enlightenment was a distinct intellectual movement that shared many ideas with the European Enlightenment

ModerateAndRadical.text: "American Enlightenment thought integrates both moderate and radical elements

SixKeyIdeas.text: "At least six ideas came to punctuate American Enlightenment thinking: deism

Deism.text: "Deism was a central idea in American Enlightenment thinking

Liberalism.text: "Liberalism was a major theme in American Enlightenment thought

Republicanism.text: "Classical republicanism was a commitment to the notion that a nation ought to be ruled as a republic

Conservatism.text: "Conservatism emerged in the last stage of the Enlightenment

Toleration.text: "Toleration or tolerant pluralism was a major theme in American Enlightenment thought

ScientificProgress.text: "Scientific progress was a key idea in American Enlightenment thinking

Franklin.text: "Benjamin Franklin was a key figure in the American Enlightenment

Madison.text: "James Madison was a key figure in the American Enlightenment

ContemporaryWork.text: "Invocations of universal freedom draw their inspiration from Enlightenment thinkers

EnlightenmentProject.text: "The American Enlightenment project signifies how America has taken a leading role in promoting Enlightenment ideals during the period of modernity."

Legacy.text: "There is no consensus about the exact legacy of American Enlightenment thinkers

References.text: "There are several important works on the American Enlightenment

AuthorInfo.text: "Shane J. Ralston is the author of this article
